sentences.en: an ignominious end to his career
sentences.cn: 他职业生涯不光彩的终结

sentences.en: Before Him was a life of sorrow , hardship , and conflict, and an ignominious death.
sentences.cn: 他所面临的是忧伤 、 艰苦和奋斗的一生,最后还要蒙羞而死.

sentences.en: Four years ago, he suffered an ignominious first - round exit.
sentences.cn: 四年前, 他遭受了首轮出局的耻辱.

sentences.en: He found himself indicted for arson and attempted murder, his career an abrupt and ignominious end.
sentences.cn: 他被指控犯有纵火罪和谋杀未遂.他的事业忽然间落了个可耻的下场.

sentences.en: He found himself indicted for arson and attempted murder, his career an abrupt ignominious end.
sentences.cn: 他被指控犯有纵火罪和谋杀未遂.他的事业突然间落了个可耻的下场.

sentences.en: It is an ignominious thing to attack others in the back.
sentences.cn: 在别人背后下刀子是一件非常不光彩的事.

sentences.en: Many thought that he was doomed to ignominious failure.
sentences.cn: 许多人认为他注定会极不光彩地失败。

sentences.en: The conspiracy frittered away to an ignominious conclusion.
sentences.cn: 那个阴谋以可耻的失败而告终.

sentences.en: The conspiracy frittered away to ignominious conclusion.
sentences.cn: 这一阴谋以不光彩的结局销声匿迹了.

sentences.en: The majority of people do some ignominious matters, Carroll Saunders have not been exceptional.
sentences.cn: 大部分人都做过一些不光彩的事, 卡罗尔?桑德斯也不例外.

sentences.en: The marriage was considered especially ignominious since she was of royal descent.
sentences.cn: 由于她出身王族,这门婚事被认为是奇耻大辱.

trans.tran_cn: 耻辱的，不光彩的，不名誉的，丢脸的
trans.tran_en: making you feel ashamed or embarrassed
